TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed OracleType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the data type of a field or property for use in an .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following table shows mappings between OracleType data types, Oracle data types, and .NET Framework types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType BFile = int32(1)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains a reference to binary data with a maximum size of 4 gigabytes that is stored in an external file. Use the OracleClient data type with the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Blob = int32(2)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains binary data with a maximum size of 4 gigabytes. Use the OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Byte = int32(23)

Docs.summary: An integral type representing unsigned 8-bit integers with values between 0 and 255. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided to improve performance when binding input parameters. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.Byte> data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Char = int32(3)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains a fixed-length character string with a maximum size of 2,000 bytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.String> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Clob = int32(4)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains character data, based on the default character set on the server, with a maximum size of 4 gigabytes. Use the OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Cursor = int32(5)

Docs.summary: An Oracle . The object is not available.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType DateTime = int32(6)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains a fixed-length representation of a date and time, ranging from January 1, 4712 B.C. to December 31, A.D. 4712, with the default format *dd-mmm-yy*. For A.D. dates, maps to <xref:System.DateTime>. To bind B.C. dates, use a parameter and the Oracle TO_DATE or TO_CHAR conversion functions for input and output parameters respectively. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.DateTime> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Double = int32(30)

Docs.summary: A double-precision floating-point value. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided to improve performance when binding input parameters. For information about conversion of Oracle numeric values to common language runtime (CLR) data types, see . Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.Double> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Float = int32(29)

Docs.summary: A single-precision floating-point value. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided to improve performance when binding input parameters. For information about conversion of Oracle numeric values to common language runtime data types, see . Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.Single> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Int16 = int32(27)

Docs.summary: An integral type representing signed 16-bit integers with values between -32768 and 32767. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided to improve performance when binding input parameters. For information about conversion of Oracle numeric values to common language runtime (CLR) data types, see . Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.Int16> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Int32 = int32(28)

Docs.summary: An integral type representing signed 32-bit integers with values between -2147483648 and 2147483647. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided for performance when binding input parameters. For information about conversion of Oracle numeric values to common language runtime data types, see . Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.Int32> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType IntervalDayToSecond = int32(7)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type (Oracle 9i or later) that contains an interval of time in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, and has a fixed size of 11 bytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.TimeSpan> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType IntervalYearToMonth = int32(8)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type (Oracle 9i or later) that contains an interval of time in years and months, and has a fixed size of 5 bytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.Int32> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType LongRaw = int32(9)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains variable-length binary data with a maximum size of 2 gigabytes. Use the .NET Framework or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you update a column with the `LONG RAW` data type, an exception is thrown when you enter a value of `NULL` in the column. The Oracle `LONG RAW` data type is a deprecated type in Oracle version 8.0. To avoid this error, use the `BLOB` data type instead of `LONG RAW`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType LongVarChar = int32(10)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains a variable-length character string with a maximum size of 2 gigabytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.String> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType NChar = int32(11)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains fixed-length character string to be stored in the national character set of the database, with a maximum size of 2,000 bytes (not characters) when stored in the database. The size of the value depends on the national character set of the database. See your Oracle documentation for more information. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.String> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType NClob = int32(12)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains character data to be stored in the national character set of the database, with a maximum size of 4 gigabytes (not characters) when stored in the database. The size of the value depends on the national character set of the database. See your Oracle documentation for more information. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.String> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Number = int32(13)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains variable-length numeric data with a maximum precision and scale of 38. This maps to <xref:System.Decimal>. To bind an Oracle that exceeds what <xref:System.Decimal.MaxValue> can contain, either use an data type, or use a parameter and the Oracle TO_NUMBER or TO_CHAR conversion functions for input and output parameters respectively. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.Decimal> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType NVarChar = int32(14)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains a variable-length character string stored in the national character set of the database, with a maximum size of 4,000 bytes (not characters) when stored in the database. The size of the value depends on the national character set of the database. See your Oracle documentation for more information. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.String> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Raw = int32(15)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains variable-length binary data with a maximum size of 2,000 bytes. Use the .NET Framework or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType RowId = int32(16)

Docs.summary: The base64 string representation of an Oracle data type. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.String> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType SByte = int32(26)

Docs.summary: An integral type representing signed 8 bit integers with values between -128 and 127. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided to improve performance when binding input parameters. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.SByte> data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType Timestamp = int32(18)

Docs.summary: An Oracle (Oracle 9i or later) that contains date and time (including seconds), and ranges in size from 7 to 11 bytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.DateTime> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType TimestampLocal = int32(19)

Docs.summary: An Oracle (Oracle 9i or later) that contains date, time, and a reference to the original time zone, and ranges in size from 7 to 11 bytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.DateTime> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType TimestampWithTZ = int32(20)

Docs.summary: An Oracle (Oracle 9i or later) that contains date, time, and a specified time zone, and has a fixed size of 13 bytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.DateTime> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType UInt16 = int32(24)

Docs.summary: An integral type representing unsigned 16-bit integers with values between 0 and 65535. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided to improve performance when binding input parameters. For information about conversion of Oracle numeric values to common language runtime (CLR) data types, see . Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.UInt16> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType UInt32 = int32(25)

Docs.summary: An integral type representing unsigned 32-bit integers with values between 0 and 4294967295. This is not a native Oracle data type, but is provided to improve performance when binding input parameters. For information about conversion of Oracle numeric values to common language runtime (CLR) data types, see . Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.UInt32> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.OracleClient.OracleType VarChar = int32(22)

Docs.summary: An Oracle data type that contains a variable-length character string with a maximum size of 4,000 bytes. Use the .NET Framework <xref:System.String> or OracleClient data type in <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleParameter.Value%2A>.
